update.description:
This is the first of a series of pull requests to add functionality to automatically generate widgets from Ignition Messages.

These widgets can be used in a variety of ways, the plugin `TopicInterface` shows how they can be used to display data as it comes through an Ignition Transport topic. Other ways to use it include, for example, substituting the free-form text field in `plugins::Publisher` with widgets.

Most of the development is happening on branch `topic_interface`. On this branch, I took the core features and one widget type as a minimal working example.

The code here started as a refactor of `gazebo::gui::ConfigWidget` and keeps much of its functionality, but is more modular. Especially the tests have been kept very similar to those of `ConfigWidget_TEST` to make sure we offer the same features.

There is more documentation on each header, here's a summary:

* `plugins::TopicInterface`: the plugin holds a `MessageWidget` and provides Ignition Transport interfaces to it. For now, all it does is subscribing to a topic and updating the widget as new messages arrive. In the future, it will offer other parameters to configure things such as which widgets are visible and enabled, and also publish messages as the user inputs data.

* `MessageWidget`: a widget generated from a protobuf message. Each field in the message corresponds to a `PropertyWidget`. There will be more features coming here as well, mainly ways to configure each property.

* `PropertyWidget`: abstract base class for widgets holding properties.

* `StringWidget`: a `PropertyWidget` which holds a string value. Other property widgets can be seen on the `topic_interface` branch and will be added in future pull requests.

* `CollapsibleWidget`: A widget which can be collapsed.

# Run example

Example showing 2 widgets, one generated from a `msgs::StringMsg` and another from a `msgs::Plugin`:

`ign gui -v 4 -c examples/config/topicInterface.config`

![stringmsg.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/4046020107-stringmsg.gif)

![pluginmsg.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2424589113-pluginmsg.gif)
update.title: Widgets from messages (part 1)

content.raw: I *think* it won't be currently possible, because we update the member msg. The main use for `this->dataPtr->msg` is to check the type though, so we could get rid of it.
content.html: I think it won't be currently possible, because we update the member msg. The main use for this->dataPtr->msg is to check the type though, so we could get rid of it.

content.raw: `const` method?
content.html: const method?

content.raw: `const` method?
content.html: const method?

content.raw: Actually it's avoiding the button widget, `this->layout()` is the `mainLayout` from above. I'll add a note.
content.html: Actually it's avoiding the button widget, this->layout() is the mainLayout from above. I'll add a note.

content.raw: Not needed, I don't think this actually creates any functions. This is just registering non-Qt types with Qt so that they can be used in `QVariant`. This also helps using them in signals and slots, but for that we actually need to call something else, which I omitted until we actually need it.
content.html: Not needed, I don't think this actually creates any functions. This is just registering non-Qt types with Qt so that they can be used in QVariant. This also helps using them in signals and slots, but for that we actually need to call something else, which I omitted until we actually need it.

content.raw: Just checking: Are you starting the loop from `1` because you want to ignore `mainLayout`?
content.html: Just checking: Are you starting the loop from 1 because you want to ignore mainLayout?

content.raw: Do you want to check `SetValue()` and `Value()` somewhere in this file?
content.html: Do you want to check SetValue() and Value() somewhere in this file?

update.description:
This is the first of a series of pull requests to add functionality to automatically generate widgets from Ignition Messages.

These widgets can be used in a variety of ways, the plugin `TopicInterface` shows how they can be used to display data as it comes through an Ignition Transport topic. Other ways to use it include, for example, substituting the free-form text field in `plugins::Publisher` with widgets.

Most of the development is happening on branch `topic_interface`. On this branch, I took the core features and one widget type as a minimal working example.

The code here started as a refactor of `gazebo::gui::ConfigWidget` and keeps much of its functionality, but is more modular. Especially the tests have been kept very similar to those of `ConfigWidget_TEST` to make sure we offer the same features.

There is more documentation on each header, here's a summary:

* `plugins::TopicInterface`: the plugin holds a `MessageWidget` and provides Ignition Transport interfaces to it. For now, all it does is subscribing to a topic and updating the widget as new messages arrive. In the future, it will offer other parameters to configure things such as which widgets are visible and enabled, and also publish messages as the user inputs data.

* `MessageWidget`: a widget generated from a protobuf message. Each field in the message corresponds to a `PropertyWidget`. There will be more features coming here as well, mainly ways to configure each property.

* `PropertyWidget`: abstract base class for widgets holding properties.

* `StringWidget`: a `PropertyWidget` which holds a string value. Other property widgets can be seen on the `topic_interface` branch and will be added in future pull requests.

* `CollapsibleWidget`: A widget which can be collapsed.

# Run example

Example showing 2 widgets, one generated from a `msgs::StringMsg` and another from a `msgs::Plugin`:

`ign gui -v 4 -c examples/config/topicInterface.config`

![stringmsg.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/4046020107-stringmsg.gif)

![pluginmsg.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2424589113-pluginmsg.gif)

content.html: Yeah I see what you're saying. I also thought of moving the logic to StringWidget. Maybe we can have a helper function which returns the widget type according to the key, something similar to unitFromKey, maybe stringTypeFromKey?

content.raw:
mm not sure what the best way is to let users specify widget type based on field type.  Maybe we can default it to `LINE` and let users change it later by doing something like `PropertyWidgetByName(..)->SetType(..)`. 

just an idea for now, no need to change anything.
content.html:
mm not sure what the best way is to let users specify widget type based on field type. Maybe we can default it to LINE and let users change it later by doing something like PropertyWidgetByName(..)->SetType(..).

just an idea for now, no need to change anything.

These widgets can be used in a variety of ways, the plugin `TopicInterface` shows how they can be used to display data as it comes through an Ignition Transport topic. Other ways to use it include, for example, substituting the free-form text field in `plugins::Publisher` with widgets.

The code here started as a refactor of `gazebo::gui::ConfigWidget` and keeps much of its functionality, but is more modular. Especially the tests have been kept very similar to those of `ConfigWidget_TEST` to make sure we offer the same features.

There is more documentation on each header, here's a summary:

* `plugins::TopicInterface`: the plugin holds a `MessageWidget` and provides Ignition Transport interfaces to it. For now, all it does is subscribing to a topic and updating the widget as new messages arrive. In the future, it will offer other parameters to configure things such as which widgets are visible and enabled, and also publish messages as the user inputs data.

* `MessageWidget`: a widget generated from a protobuf message. Each field in the message corresponds to a `PropertyWidget`. There will be more features coming here as well, mainly ways to configure each property.

* `PropertyWidget`: abstract base class for widgets holding properties.

* `StringWidget`: a `PropertyWidget` which holds a string value. Other property widgets can be seen on the `topic_interface` branch and will be added in future pull requests.

* `CollapsibleWidget`: A widget which can be collapsed.

# Run example

Example showing 2 widgets, one generated from a `msgs::StringMsg` and another from a `msgs::Plugin`:

`ign gui -v 4 -c examples/config/topicInterface.config`

![stringmsg.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/4046020107-stringmsg.gif)

![pluginmsg.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2424589113-pluginmsg.gif)
